results.title: Justice, liberty and law: an introduction
results.brief_description: The American Bill of Rights provides a focal point for discussion of the ideal of justice. What is right and fair? Rights of the individual are raised for discussion. Individual rights to protest and the need to keep law and order are presented as conflicting interests. A number of people who hold opposing views are interviewed. Suitable for upper secondary level.
results.description: The American Bill of Rights provides a focal point for discussion of the ideal of justice. What is right and fair? Rights of the individual are raised for discussion. results.title: Just swimming
results.creator_credit: John Cooper, Tom Williamson and New Zealand National Film Unit
results.brief_description: A motivational film showing the variety of water activities that can be enjoyed once the skills of swimming have been acquired. Features scuba diving, water ballet, water hockey and basketball, competitive swimming, surfing and marathon swimming.

results.title: Just Out of Reach
results.brief_description: A portrayal of a young woman’s conflict with an unresponsive world. Cath is rushed to hospital after a suicide attempt and the film traces back to her adolescence to reveal what has led to a despair so severe that suicide appears to be her only option. Her conflicts with her family, principally with her father, are later identified in her relationship with her husband. Each leads her to attempt suicide. Both attempts are the result of her utter despair at the loss of the love of the person who matters the most to her.

results.title: Just like you
results.creator_credit: Eugene Osborne Smith and Stephen Bosustow Productions
results.brief_description: Society is made up of all sorts of people who share common hopes and dreams. Each person should be able to advance according to ability. However, the difference between people create conflicts and barriers that hinder the success of some. A montage of photographs accompanied by the poem ‘Just Like You’ presents these concepts.

results.title: Just desserts
results.creator_credit: Monica Pellizzari and NRG Films Australia
results.brief_description: This delicious comedy about an Italo-Australian girl’s sexual awakening and her love for her mama’s cooking is written, produced and directed by Monica Pellizzari. Through the use of a split screen which separates the food from the experience, issues such as menstruation, masturbation, lesbianism and virginity are explored, against a backdrop of broth, venetian fritters, polenta, dumplings and pizza. Cast includes Dina Panozzo and Anne-Louise Lambert.

results.title: Just Australian Planes
results.brief_description: Narrated by Aden Wickes, Senior Check Captain with Qantas, this film contains extraordinary rare footage of different kinds of aeroplanes, past and present, and their respective pilots. It charts a unique aeronautical journey in time, from the beginnings of the RAAF to the more fanciful, high tech aircraft of today.

results.title: Just a trace
results.creator_credit: Jack Rogers, Shan Benson and Australian Commonwealth Film Unit
results.brief_description: Just a trace of some element - cobalt, copper, or molybdenum can give rich pasture and healthy sheep where until recently the desert defied the farmer. The film shows how South Australian areas once fit only for scrub have been transformed into prosperous farms. Many countries, as well as Australia, are now benefiting from the important research work in this field undertaken by Commonwealth Scientific and Industrial Research Organisation.

results.title: Jungle patrol
results.creator_credit: Tom Gurr and Commonwealth Department of Information
results.brief_description: An account of a jungle patrol by eight Australian soldiers in the Dumpu to Shaggy Ridge area of New Guinea during WWII. The film unit flew with the Australian patrol to the Ramu Valley and marched with it to the outpost of Shaggy Ridge in the Finisterre Range. The film shows the difficulties and dangers of the campaign - rain, mud swamps, tangled jungles and steep mountains - with the cameraman taking all risks under fire from the enemy. The soldiers were: Pte A.N. McGregor, L/Cpl A.C. Pierson, Pte R.F.C. Northcott, Pte A.B. Graffin, Pte M.J. Driver, Cpl R.A. Box, Pte J.H. Adams, Pte E. Barmby. Photography by J.W. Trerise and William Carty.
